info.name: test: exact floats
info.description:
integers and their divisions by power of 2 can be stored exactly in floats.
But division often breaks this, and thus mod as well ( in particular, 3./3. is not exactly 1 ).
If you see a grid of dots, you have exact (1.+z)/(64.+z) and mod(U,3).
Tell me !
